phenotype_entities.name: Cognitive impairment with or without cerebellar ataxia

assertions_made.justification: GeneReviews explicitly frames a single spectrum: “SCN8A-related epilepsy and/or neurodevelopmental disorders encompasses a spectrum of phenotypes.” OMIM and Orphanet list multiple named phenotypes but within overlapping features attributable to SCN8A.

molecular_mechanism.justification: All disorders arise from heterozygous SCN8A variants with mixed functional effects (gain-, loss-, partial loss-of-function) across the spectrum. The same or similar mechanisms can underlie different phenotypic severities, and even LOF can present with epilepsy or ID, arguing against distinct mechanistic entities.

phenotypic_variability.justification: Phenotypes range from severe DEE to self-limited infantile epilepsy to isolated neurodevelopmental disorder, with reports of the same variant showing different severities and incomplete penetrance. This intrafamilial and interfamilial variability suggests a continuum rather than discrete diseases.

mode_of_inheritance.justification: All human conditions listed are autosomal dominant germline. No separate recessive or X-linked phenotypes are described in the provided human sources.

entity_decisions.name: Cognitive impairment with or without cerebellar ataxia

entities: Cognitive impairment with or without cerebellar ataxia
proposed_groupings.reasoning: GeneReviews defines a single AD spectrum encompassing DEE, self-limited infantile epilepsy, and neurodevelopmental disorder without epilepsy; mechanisms overlap (GOF/LOF/partial LOF) and variants can yield differing severities.

overall_decision.summary_reasoning: Authoritative sources (GeneReviews) assert one SCN8A-related spectrum with autosomal dominant inheritance. Although functional effects vary (GOF/LOF), they do not segregate cleanly with discrete, non-overlapping phenotypes, and the same variant can be associated with different severities. Marked variable expressivity and shared management considerations support lumping into a single entity.

top_supporting_evidence: GeneReviews: “SCN8A-related epilepsy and/or neurodevelopmental disorders encompasses a spectrum of phenotypes.”
OMIM (DEE13 N1768D): “consistent with a dominant gain-of-function phenotype… neuronal hyperexcitability.”; OMIM (CIAT G964R/E1218K): “complete loss of channel activity.”

OMIM (.0011): “The same variant [N1877S] has been identified in patients with a more severe disorder… consistent with developmental and epileptic encephalopathy-13… The benign phenotype… suggests additional variants… protective effect.”
suggested_action_for_curator: Verify whether any emerging recessive or distinct mechanistic subtypes (e.g., consistent haploinsufficiency vs specific GOF) warrant future splitting as more data accrue.
Confirm consistent use of the unified label “SCN8A-related epilepsy and/or neurodevelopmental disorders” in ClinVar/ClinGen records and map OMIM/Orphanet phenotype terms to this spectrum.
